title: John Neal, a bookseller that specializes in calligraphy
content:
"Since 1981 [**John Neal, Bookseller**](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019004944/http:/www.johnnealbooks.com/) has supplied calligraphers, lettering artists, illuminators, bookbinders, type and papercraft enthusiasts worldwide with books, tools, and materials. We also publish [_Letter Arts Review_](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019004944/http:/www.johnnealbooks.com/prod_detail_list/14), a full color journal on the lettering arts, and [_Bound & Lettered_](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019004944/http:/www.johnnealbooks.com/prod_detail_list/63), a quarterly magazine on making books and making letters."

(Via [Quipsologies](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019004944/http:/www.underconsideration.com/quipsologies/).)
author: Ricardo Cordoba

comments.content: Their catalogue is amazing, as are those from [Talas](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019004944/http:/talasonline.com/) (in NYC) and [J. Hewit & Sons Ltd.](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019004944/http:/www.hewit.com/)(in Currie, near Edinburgh).
As if I don’t spend enough on this stuff already...only $60 this week!
I should have also included [Oak Knoll Books and Oak Knoll Press](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019004944/http:/www.oakknoll.com/) -- they even have a whole typography section. ;-)
Oak Knoll... Yeah, they always have good stuff.
